alert.note: Alert for Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 5:38PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL OCEAN AND EAST CENTRAL BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 537 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chatsworth, or 21 miles southwest of Toms River, moving east at 30 mph. This storm has a history of producing quarter to ping pong ball sized hail within the last hour. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Tuckerton, Brookville, Warren Grove, Bass River State Forest, Bamber Lake, Chatsworth, Old Halfway, Penn State Forest and Ocean Acres. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 56 and 60. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southern New Jersey. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
